    • Constructor Detail

      • Room

        Room(java.util.Scanner s,
     Dungeon d)
throws Room.NoRoomException,
     Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException
        constructor used for when starting to read a file
        Parameters:
        s - Scanner used for Scanning the File being read from the dungeon class
        d - Dungeon for which the room will belong
        Throws:
        Room.NoRoomException - self explanitory, thrown if no room is found in the reading of a file
        Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException

      • Room

        Room(java.util.Scanner s,
     Dungeon d,
     boolean initState)
throws Room.NoRoomException,
     Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException
        Given a Scanner object positioned at the beginning of a "room" file entry, read and return a Room object representing it.
        Parameters:
        d - The containing edu.umw.stephen.bork.Dungeon object, necessary to retrieve edu.umw.stephen.bork.Item objects.
        initState - should items listed for this room be added to it?
        Throws:
        Room.NoRoomException - The reader object is not positioned at the start of a room entry. A side effect of this is the reader's cursor is now positioned one line past where it was.
        IllegalDungeonFormatException - A structural problem with the dungeon file itself, detected when trying to read this room.
        Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException

        Room(java.lang.String title)
        constructor for Room class
        Parameters:
        title - String title of the room

        public java.lang.String describe()
